Striker Marouane Chamakh and midfielder Kieran Richardson have left Cardiff City, boss Neil Warnock has confirmed.

The duo signed as free agents in the week of Warnock's arrival, with Chamakh signing on 11 October and Richardson arriving 24 hours later.

"They have left this week," Warnock explained at his weekly press briefing.

"They have been good professionals, but we need to manipulate this squad and those two are easy as their contracts are up. They will both find clubs."

Richardson made six appearances for the Bluebirds, while Chamakh featured only twice, both times as a substitute.

Top-five Arsenal Premier League goals in 2016

https://youtu.be/_GABloV1iB8

Xhaka - My pride at 'positive' 2016

“Half a year in Germany, half a year in England… so I was with Monchengladbach from January through to June, where we qualified for the Champions League, which made for a very interesting season,” the midfielder told Arsenal Player.

“Then the transfer here to Arsenal, which I'm very proud of and made me very happy. I'm glad to have been able to make that step and I think the second half of the year has gone pretty positively.

“There have been a lot of nice highlights. The national team are doing great in qualifying for the World Cup so far, we're in first [position in the group].

“We achieved what we wanted to with Gladbach - the Champions League qualification - and I was able to make the next big step in my career to Arsenal. So it's all been very positive.

“I’m very happy, very proud, not only of myself but also my people, my family. They've given me plenty of support. That's obviously very important to me.”

Arsene Wenger has provided the latest team news update ahead of Sunday’s Premier League clash with Crystal Palace.

After the 1-0 win over West Brom, we’ll be without Kieran Gibbs who suffered some damage to his knee in a collision with Claudio Jacob.

“I don’t think Kieran Gibbs will be available,” he said. “Apart from that Mustafi is fit again, and we have one or two uncertainties.

“We have a few with flu, but overall everybody should be available.

“Walcott has a calf problem, it’s short-term, but I don’t think he’ll be available for Sunday.”

So, let’s hope that those feeling a bit under the weather are better by Sunday.

Mustafi fit, Walcott out

The Gunners boss is on the building. And he starts with some team news.

“I don’t think Kieran Gibbs will be available. Apart from that Mustafi is fit again and we have one or two uncertainties .

“A few with flu but everybody else should be available. Gibbs has a knee problem and Walcott has a calf problem, short term, I don’t think he will available this week.”


Welbeck "looks quite good"

Danny Welbeck returned to training this week and Wenger sounds upbeat over the England striker:

“Welbeck is fit and sharp. He is in training and he looks quite good.”

Wenger: Premier League has been "disappointing" this season

Wenger is now asked for his thoughts on 2016. Here goes:

“I assess it in two parts. We finished second in the league last season, it was Leicester’s year 2016 overall for us it was disappointing not to win the league,” he begins.

“After that the second part of the year we have moved our level up but we are in the middle of the championship now. It was a very promising championship with the best managers in the world competing and it promises to be an exceptional year but until now disappointing on all levels because the Premier League has not produced the games that are remembered but in the second part I expect the level and spectacularity of the games will go up and we have a responsibility to do that.”
é˜¿ä»™å¥´å¾—äº†æ–½æ²»å¾Œï¼Œå¾Œé˜²çš„é˜²å®ˆåŠ›æ˜é¡¯æ¯”ä¹‹å‰æå‡äº†ï¼Œå¯èƒ½çƒå“¡è¦‹åˆ°æ–½æ²»åŠ ç›Ÿï¼Œä¿¡å¿ƒä¹Ÿæé«˜äº†ï¼Œå†ä¸ç”¨é¡§è‘—é–€å°‡ï¼ŒæŠŠå®ˆæœ€å¾Œä¸€é—œæ˜¯æ–½æ²»ï¼Œå†ä¸æ˜¯è‰¾è’™å°¼äºä¾¿å¯ã€‚

Wenger on Big Sam

Onto Sunday’s game now and Wenger is asked if Palace are a more difficult prospect now that Sam Allardyce is in charge.

“The level of confidence and urgency goes up when a new manager comes in and that makes the games more difficult,” he says.

And he insists that he is not surprised that Big Sam is back in the game after all the shenanigans that went on earlier this year.

“No not really because today the clubs in trouble looked for experienced managers.

“To stay in the league has become a big problem for everybody and when teams look for managers he was one with the experience and quality. After that it is moral judgement. I don’t know how guilty he was of doing something or not. He was in a strong position as national team manager. That means he has the quality to be there.”

Wenger on Debuchy: We speak

Mathieu Debuchy next, after the Gunners defender said he is no longer on speaking terms with his compatriot.

“We speak,” says Wenger.

“I communicate with all the players. it is a frustrated article from a player who is injured. When he had opportunity to play when Bellerin was injured he was injured. If I gave him last year the opportunity to go to Bordeaux on loan but we had nobody coming in in the summer period.

There are some things that are not true in his article so you have to take this article with a bit of distance. Manchester United didn’t make an offer for him. That is untrue. It is surprising to hear something like that.”

The weekly Ozil/Sanchez/Ox contract question

“There are no updates.”

Next.

More on Ozil: "He has improved his commitment"

Wenger is now addressing the criticism of Mesut Ozil.

“He is a huge player. I have always defended him.

“He has improved his commitment and works harder than people think he does. I still think there is a gap between his potential finishing and the way he does. In training he finishes better than the games and I’m convinced his percentage of finishing will go up in the coming months.He works hard but he had one or two games where he was frustrated.

“The one that comes to my mind is the Manchester City game where he was criticised but when you look at his whole contribution he has done fantastic.”


On Benteke's penalty

Christian Benteke’s dodgy penalty is the next topic up for discussion. Does Wenger have an ideal penalty?

“The ideal penalty doesn’t exist, it is just when the ball hits the net,” he says. And he has a point.

“I encourage just to be as simple as possible. If you look at Euro 2016 there were games when only the defenders scored and the strikers missed because they wanted to be too complicated. it is a difficult exercise but since i have been in football from Pele to Messi everybody misses but it is not as easy as it looks.”

Palace 'can be difficult for everybody'

What about Palace’s potential?

“They have experience and technical quality. They are a team that can be difficult for everybody. But they have some injuries and suspensions so I don’t know if they have enough depth.”

On Chelsea's run: 'Records are there to be broken'

Wenger is next asked about Chelsea being close to breaking Arsenal’s winning run.

“What they do is fantastic. If they do it is marvellous because nobody expected that at the start.

“They had a dodgy start but since they changed their system and went on a run confidence plays a big part.

“If they do it you can only say well done, records are there to be broken.

More on Chelsea

Wenger is next asked how impressed he is with Chelsea since the Gunners beat them earlier this season.
“They have addressed well their problems. You have to give credit to Conte. They bought Luiz who stabilised their defensive record and they have been the most consistent until now,” he says.

And does he worry about a potential 12 point gap by the time his side kick-off against Palace on January 1?
“I am worried about our next performance. we have to look at our next performance and fightback.”

Giroud 'always has a big role'

And what about Olivier Giroud, who bailed the Gunners out against West Brom?

“For me he always has a big role, even when he didn’t start he had a big impact. It is down to me to use the players well.”

Most importantly and for the first time since Puma took over at the Emirates, the Arsenal 2017-2018 home shirt will have a darker, "more historic" shade of red than usual - but it won't be quite as dark as the 2005-06 Highbury goodbye edition. The official name of the color for the Arsenal 17-18 kit is 'Chilli Pepper' and it was used for the darker parts of the 2016 Czech Republic jersey, for example.



Otherwise, the Puma Arsenal 2017-18 jersey is expected to be kept rather simple and clean, in line with the whole historic inspiration. It's confirmed that the Arsenal cannon will be present on the shirt, while the sleeves will certainly be white as is tradition.

Shorts and socks of the Arsenal 2017-2018 home kit are expected to be white, although it's not confirmed in the latter case.

A May 25, 2017, launch is planned for the Arsenal 17-18 shirt.

The Arsenal 2017-2018 away jersey will combine different shades of blue, similar to various Arsenal away and third shirts of the past few years. Designed to combine a "sense of style with a touch of class", the new Arsenal 2017-18 away kit will feature a "blurred fusion of color in cool fresh shades of blue". It is officially colored Blue Danube (light blue) and Limoges (dark blue).

We expect the new Puma Arsenal 2017-2018 away shirt will be combined with white or dark blue applications, unlike Puma's first blue Arsenal kit yet that was mixed with garish green details and applications.

The color of the shorts and socks of the new Arsenal away kit is not known yet.

Ramsey on the Euros: "It was a fantastic experience. What the boys achieved was beyond all expectations so that made it even more special."

Ramsey: "You have to get your fitness up, work your way back in, so it's frustrating but now I'm just looking forwards & staying fit." #afc

Ramsey: "You want to get consistency in your game & feel comfortable, but as soon as you're in & out of the team, it takes a while." #afc

Ramsey: "I wanted to kick on & get going this season, but it's been a bit stop-start again. It's something I'm trying to work on." #afc

Aaron Ramsey: "It's obviously been a very frustrating season for me so far, especially coming off a very good Euros with Wales." #afc
